result.execSummary:
The defendant Kevin Matthew Robinson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

10:01 AM Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: K Kittel. Attorney Michael Becker in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Jeremiah James Harrelson in court w/ Kevin Matthew Robinson.  INCLUDES:  21CF891,21CF879, 22CF333, and 22CF348.  21CF891 was set for FPT. Court notes a global resolution on the matters  listed, BR 2 and BR 4 allow for BR 3 to hear PLEAS. Atty Harrelson states agreement on record. Court reads charges and maximum penalties. DE pleads Guilty of Amended Ct 1 (simple poss, no repeater) in 21CF891, Guilty of Amended Ct 1 (no repeater) in 22CF333, guilty of Ct 4 in 22CF348. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Amended Ct 1  in  21CF891,  guilty of Amended Ct 1 in 22CF333, and guilty of Ct 4 in 22CF348. On motion of the State without objection, Crt reads in and dismisses: Cts 2 and 3 in 21CF891,  21CF879 in its entirety, Ct 2 in 22CF333, and Cts 1,2,3,5 in 22CF348 all with prejudice. State is in compliance with victims rights. Attys do not request PSI. Sentencing arguments. DE makes statements. Court orders: 

S/W; 3 years' probation with conditions on 21CF891 and 22CF333, 1 year probation with conditions on 22CF348. All cases running concurrent to 21CF891: 
120 days condition time; 60 days stayed for purposes of further programming.  DE to serve 20 days per year during the duration of probation, to be coordinated with Agent.

Amended Ct 1 in 21CF891 - 
- Court Costs: $  268.00; apply bond, balance through probation  
- DNA Surcharge: $250.00; apply bond, balance through probation  
 
Amended Ct 1 in 22CF333 - 
- Court Costs: $  268.00; apply bond, balance through probation    
- DNA Surcharge: $250.00; apply bond, balance through probation  

Ct 4 in 22CF348 - 
- Court Costs: $  243.00; apply bond, balance through probation     
- DNA Surcharge: $200.00; apply bond, balance through probation  
- No contact with Candi T's residence while trespass is in force 

Conditions of Probation in all cases:
- AODA and follow through 
- Test randomly and regularly 
- Absolute sobriety
- Not to associate with any persons known or suspected to be involved in use, trafficking, dealing or manufacturing of illegal drugs except in a treatment setting.
- Obtain any additional assessments 
- Maintain current mental health treatment and take medications as prescribed
- Maintain treatment at Twin Towns
- Follow rules and regulations of Agent
- Pay supervision fees
- Sign up for probation by Noon 10/24/22. 

20 days to appeal

Includes 21CF891, 21CF879, 22CF333, 22CF348.

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

I understand that I must report to and comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Justice Support Center. I further understand that I am required to submit to random drug testing at least TWO times per week. Failure to report and/or comply with conditions and/or protocols may result in a report to the District Attorney's Office, an arrest warrant, and/or referral for criminal charges.

I understand that I must IMMEDIATELY report to the Justice Support Center located adjacent to the lower parking lot of the St. Croix County Government Center. If after regular business hours I must call (715)245-4109 to schedule an appointment with the Justice Support Center by the end of the following business day. 

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, A.K.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.
